br.com.anteros.cups4j.util

Class SystemUtilities

  • java.lang.Object
    • br.com.anteros.cups4j.util.SystemUtilities

  • public class SystemUtilities
extends Object
    Utility class for OS detection functions.
    Author:
    Tres Finocchiaro

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SystemUtilities() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static String getDataDirectory()
      Returns the OS-specific Application Data directory such as: C:\Users\John\AppData\Roaming\.qz on Windows -- or -- /Users/John/Library/Application Support/.qz on Mac -- or -- /home/John/.qz on Linux
      static String getLinuxRelease()
      Returns the output of cat /etc/lsb-release or equivalent
      static String getOS()
      Returns a lowercase version of the Operating system name identified by System.getProperty("os.name");.
      static String getUname()
      Returns the output of uname -a shell command, useful for parsing the Linux Version
      static boolean isFedora()
      Returns whether the output of cat /etc/redhat-release/code> shell command contains "Fedora"
      static boolean isLinux()
      Determine if the current Operating System is Linux
      static boolean isMac()
      Determine if the current Operating System is Mac OS
      static boolean isSolaris()
      Determine if the current Operating System is Solaris
      static boolean isUbuntu()
      Returns whether the output of uname -a shell command contains "Ubuntu"
      static boolean isUnix()
      Determine if the current Operating System is Unix
      static boolean isWindows()
      Determine if the current Operating System is Windows
      static boolean setSystemLookAndFeel() 

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        public static String getDataDirectory()
        Returns the OS-specific Application Data directory such as: C:\Users\John\AppData\Roaming\.qz on Windows -- or -- /Users/John/Library/Application Support/.qz on Mac -- or -- /home/John/.qz on Linux
        Returns:
        Full path to the Application Data directory
